locutie.beschrijving: The preacher contrasts the 'natural' view of spring/renewal with the 'anti-natural' event of the Resurrection, critiquing the Jesus Seminar and liberal metaphors.
locutie.exegetische_kwaliteit: High; focuses on the 'scandal' of the empty tomb and the historical hopelessness of the disciples.

illocutie.beschrijving: The force shifts from a polemical assertion (critiquing others) to a witness-bearing testimony, culminating in a declarative victory shout.
voorbeelden: I am here as nothing more and nothing less than a witness
I believe the body of Jesus was in a tomb, and that it disappeared

perlocutie.beoogd_effect: To move the hearer from skeptical distance or 'spring-sentiment' to robust, defiant faith in the face of death.
perlocutie.pneumatologisch_bewustzijn: Implicit; the preacher relies on the 'news' itself to 'electrify' and 'convince' rather than psychological persuasion.

voorbeelden: The Resurrection has been an embarrassment to many modern, sophisticated church people.
There was no Resurrection, they declare.
Put yourself in the place of the women.
I look forward to this day more keenly each year.
I confess it is not enough for me.
His promise to return and establish his Kingdom... is true.
In Christ shall all be made alive!
commissieven.kwaliteit: Strongly grounded in the faithfulness of God rather than the preacher's will.

voorbeelden: Jesus is the Lord of the universe.
declaratieven.autoriteit: High; the preacher speaks as a 'mandataris' of the Church's confession.

indicatoren: Extensive critique of the Jesus Seminar
Lengthy description of why people are in church
Talking about the 'look of the body'
constatief_surplus_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: The hearer is well-informed about what NOT to believe, but the direct address of grace comes late.

performatief_deficit_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: The hearer remains a spectator of the preacher's own struggle and belief for much of the text.

toezegging_check.kwaliteit_toezeggen: Theologically dense but framed as 'the church's belief' rather than a direct 'I say to you'.
voorbeelden: In Christ shall all be made alive!

eerste_persoon.gebruik: Personal testimony and professional identity ('I am a witness').

tweede_persoon.gebruik: Directly addressing the 'Easter-only' attendees and the grieving woman.
tweede_persoon.performatieve_context: Used to pull the hearer into the 'hopelessness' before the 'victory'.

derde_persoon.gebruik: Discussing the Jesus Seminar, the disciples, and 'death'.
derde_persoon.distantie_effect: Creates a polemical distance between 'us' and 'them' (the skeptics).

tijdloos_present.gebruik: Theological truths about death and nature.

foutief_patroon.beschrijving: Avoids moralism; does not end with 'so you must believe'.

sacramenteel_patroon.beschrijving: Moves from the reality of death (Assertive) to the victory of Christ (Declarative) to the hope for the hearer (Commissive).
voorbeelden: Death is swallowed up in victory... It belongs to you too.
sacramenteel_patroon.kwaliteit: Strong, though the assertive section is very long.

voorbeelden_goede_verhouding: Christ has won the victory... [therefore] hope and strength and courage.

diagnostische_evaluatie.diagnose_toelichting: Despite a high word count 'talking about' the Jesus Seminar, the sermon functions as a 'witness' that culminates in a reality-changing declaration.

sterke_punten.tekstueel_bewijs: I am here as nothing more and nothing less than a witness.
sterke_punten.effect: Establishes the preacher's authority not as a teacher, but as a herald.

zwakke_punten.tekstueel_bewijs: The Jesus Seminar released its latest findings...
zwakke_punten.probleem: Spends significant time on intellectual polemics which can objectify the faith.

diagnostische_evaluatie.gebeuren_toelichting: The sermon 'happens' when it stops arguing with scholars and starts shouting at Satan.
diagnostische_evaluatie.sacramentele_toelichting: The final paragraph functions as a 'Toezegging' (Promise) that binds God's faithfulness to the hearer's life.

openbaringsleer.god_als_spreker: Yes, through the 'news' that is 'uttered with human tongue'.
openbaringsleer.prediker_als_mandataris: Yes, explicitly stated as 'my calling' and 'witness'.
tekstueel_bewijs: I am here as nothing more and nothing less than a witness.

pneumatologie.geest_rol_erkend: Implicitly; the 'electrifying' power of the word suggests the Spirit's work.
pneumatologie.perlocutie_theologie: Yes, the preacher presents the news and expects it to 'break down barricades'.
tekstueel_bewijs: The news... could convince us even to this present day.

sacramentstheologie.preek_als_genademiddel: Yes, the sermon is treated as the delivery of a victory.
sacramentstheologie.epifanisch_taalgebruik: Yes, especially the 'trumpets and timpani' section.
tekstueel_bewijs: This is the day for trumpets and timpani and organ fanfares to burst the eardrums of Satan.

aanbevelingen.werkwoord_audit_samenvatting: The sermon is heavy on 'I believe' and 'They say'. It needs more 'Christ does' and 'I tell you'.

specifieke_suggesties.huidige_formulering: I believe that the tomb was empty.
specifieke_suggesties.voorgestelde_revisie: The tomb is empty for you today.
specifieke_suggesties.verschil: Shifts from the preacher's subjective state to the hearer's objective reality.

toezegging_versterking.probleem: The promise is often mediated through 'The Church's belief'.
voorbeeldzinnen: Because He lives, you shall live also.

adressering_verbetering.suggestie: The address to the 'Easter-only' crowd is excellent; keep that directness throughout.

indicatief_imperatief_herstel.suggestie: Ensure the 'defiance' in the end is seen as a gift of the Spirit, not a human effort.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A masterful example of 'Witness' homiletics that successfully transitions from intellectual defense to sacramental proclamation.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_schulz_von_thun: SvT would focus on the preacher's 'self-revelation' about his father; SAT focuses on the 'Declarative' act of the Resurrection overcoming death.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retoriek: Rhetoric would aim to persuade the Jesus Seminar; SAT aims to 'perform' the victory of Christ over the eardrums of Satan.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_SAT: SAT reveals that the sermon's power isn't in the preacher's 'Christian intellectual' status, but in the Commissive force of God's faithfulness.

appendices.notities: The sermon successfully navigates the 'Constative Surplus' of the first half by pivoting to a high-stakes 'Declarative' finish.
